text:
1. Set up the barbell on the ground.
2. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, toes pointed slightly outwards.
3. Bend at the knees and hips to grip the barbell with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
4. Lift the barbell off the ground, keeping the back straight and chest up.
5. Stand up, extending the hips and knees fully.
6. Dip slightly by bending the knees and hips, then explosively extend the legs and hips to drive the barbell upwards.
7. As the barbell reaches its highest point, quickly drop underneath it by bending the knees and hips, while simultaneously pulling the body under the barbell.
8. Catch the barbell in a squat position, with the arms fully extended overhead.
9. Stand up from the squat position, keeping the barbell overhead.
10. Lower the barbell back to the starting position by reversing the previous steps in a controlled manner.
